channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: アマゾンが広告付き配信を推進する最新のストリーマーとなり、TV作家たちはストリーミングの本来の約束から離れた動きに不満の反応を示している（The Hollywood Reporter）。
item.description:
The Hollywood Reporter:
As Amazon becomes the latest streamer to push an ad-supported tier, TV writers react with frustration to the move away from the original promise of streaming  —  As Amazon becomes the latest platform to push an ad-supported tier, TV writers greet this retro model with frustration and …

item.title: ポリティコが欧州、ドイツ、フランスのウェブサイトをリニューアル、英米版よりシンプルなトップページにし、AIウェブクローラーの読みやすさを向上（Bron Maher/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Bron Maher / Press Gazette:
Politico redesigns its Europe, German, and French websites to have simpler homepages than the UK and US versions, to improve readability for AI web crawlers  —  Politico has given its Europe, German and French websites a redesign which improves readability for the web crawlers that feed into generative AI large language models (LLMs).

item.title: UMG、契約交渉不成立でTikTokからアーティストの楽曲を引き上げ開始、UMGアーティストの出演動画はミュートされ、ユーザーは新しいサウンドトラックを選べる（Ashley Carman/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Ashley Carman / Bloomberg:
UMG begins pulling its artists' music from TikTok after contract talks failed; videos featuring UMG artists will be muted and users can pick a new soundtrack  —  - Publisher behind Drake and Taylor Swift pushes for better pay  — Videos featuring Universal Music-owned songs will be muted

item.title: 報道の自由と腐敗防止の活動家であるベルナルド・アーキュテバロが新大統領に就任したグアテマラの報道の自由について（Jon Allsop/Columbia Journalism Review）
item.description:
Jon Allsop / Columbia Journalism Review:
A look at press freedoms in Guatemala, as pro-press freedom and anti-corruption activist Bernardo Arévalo becomes the country's new president  —  In the summer of 2022, a unit of armed police officers in Guatemala raided the home of José Rubén Zamora …

item.title: 仕事量を減らし、社外での時間を優先するワークモデルを採用することで、記者の燃え尽きを防ごうとしている小規模メディアがある（Christina Couch/Nieman Lab）
item.description:
Christina Couch / Nieman Lab:
How some small media outlets are trying to prevent reporter burnout by adopting work models that reduce workloads and prioritize time outside the office  —  Keeping reporters healthy over the long term often requires both systemic and behavioral changes, and getting buy-in often isn't easy.

item.title: 情報筋ディズニー、インド・メディア事業の60％をリライアンス傘下のViacom18に$3.9Bの評価額で売却することで予備合意（Wall Street Journal）
item.description:
Wall Street Journal:
Sources: Disney has reached a preliminary agreement to sell 60% of its Indian media business to Reliance-backed Viacom18 at a $3.9B valuation  —  Viacom18's purchase of 60% of Disney's India business reunites the company with two executives who built it  —  Disney has reached a preliminary agreement …

item.title: オニオン・ユニオン、G/Oメディアと暫定合意 交渉委員会は「賃金と職場保護で重要な利益」（Katie Campione/Deadline）
item.description:
Katie Campione / Deadline:
The Onion Union reaches a tentative agreement with G/O Media, with the negotiating committee making “important gains in wages and workplace protections”  —  The Onion Union employees have narrowly avoided a strike, reaching a tentative agreement with G/O Media just hours …

item.title: ディズニー子会社のVFX労働者がIATSEとの組合結成に投票し、NLRBの公式投票によって組合結成を果たした初の「ベンダーサイド」アーティスト集団となる（Jordan Moreau/Variety）
item.description:
Jordan Moreau / Variety:
VFX workers at a Disney subsidiary vote to unionize with the IATSE, becoming the first group of “vendor-side” artists to unionize via an official NLRB vote  —  A group of visual effects artists who work on Disney's CGI-heavy “Avatar” films have voted to unionize with the International Alliance of Theatrical Stage Employees.

item.title: 加入者へのメール：Huluは契約を変更し、「サービス・ティアが許可した場合を除き」ユーザーの世帯外でのアカウント共有を禁止した（Alex Weprin/The Hollywood Reporter）。
item.description:
Alex Weprin / The Hollywood Reporter:
Email to subscribers: Hulu changed its agreement to ban sharing accounts outside of the user's household “unless otherwise permitted by your Service Tier”  —  The Disney-owned streaming service changed its subscriber agreement to ban sharing of accounts outside of individual households.

item.title: 電子メールジミー・フィンケルスタインが2023年5月に立ち上げ、約300人を雇用（Benjamin Mullin/New York Times）。
item.description:
Benjamin Mullin / New York Times:
Email: The Messenger shuts down, effective immediately, citing economic headwinds; Jimmy Finkelstein launched the outlet in May 2023 and hired about 300 people  —  By closing less than a year after it launched, The Messenger is now one of the biggest busts in the annals of online news.

item.title: シカゴ・トリビューンを含むトリビューン系出版社のジャーナリストたちが、オールデン・グローバル・キャピタルによる経費削減に抗議するため、2月1日の1日ストライキを計画している（Laura Wagner/Washington Post）。
item.description:
Laura Wagner / Washington Post:
Journalists from Tribune publications, including the Chicago Tribune, plan a one-day strike on February 1 to protest cost-cutting by Alden Global Capital  —  To protest the cuts made by new owner Alden Global Capital, staffs plan walkouts Thursday at the Chicago Tribune …

item.title: オーダシーはパイナップル・ストリートのポッドキャスト部門で多くのポジションを削減する予定。情報筋によると、レイオフの対象となるのは12ポジションで、スタッフの〜25％にあたるという（Ashley Carman/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Ashley Carman / Bloomberg:
Audacy plans to cut a number of positions in its Pineapple Street podcast division; a source says the layoff will affect 12 positions, or ~25% of the staff  —  Audacy Inc., a radio broadcaster reorganizing in US bankruptcy court, announced plans to cut a number of positions in its Pineapple Street podcast division.

item.title: ディズニーがフロリダ州の「ゲイと言うな」法案を批判した後、報復を主張するロン・デサンティス州知事に対するディズニーの訴えを米判事が棄却、ディズニーは控訴する予定（Dan Mangan/CNBC）
item.description:
Dan Mangan / CNBC:
A US judge dismisses Disney's suit against Gov. Ron DeSantis claiming retaliation after Disney criticized Florida's “Don't Say Gay” bill; Disney plans to appeal  —  - A judge dismissed a lawsuit Disney filed against Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis that alleged he retaliated against the company …

item.title: LAタイムズ、WSJなどが選挙の年にDC支局を削減、より収益性の高いコアコンピタンスに注力（Mark Stenberg/Adweek）
item.description:
Mark Stenberg / Adweek:
LA Times, WSJ, and others are cutting their DC bureaus in an election year, as they focus on their core competencies that are likely better sources of return  —  An emphasis on subscriptions and changing coverage landscapes help explain  —  Both the Los Angeles Times and The Wall Street Journal …

item.title: アレックス・クーパー、スポティファイとの3年総額6,000万ドルの契約終了後、大ヒットインタビューポッドキャスト「Call Her Daddy」をすべての主要オーディオプラットフォームでリリース（Todd Spangler/Variety）
item.description:
Todd Spangler / Variety:
Alex Cooper releases her hit Call Her Daddy interview podcast on all major audio platforms, after its three year, $60M deal with Spotify ended  —  Daddy Gang, rejoice! … Full episodes of “Call Her Daddy” have been available only on Spotify since July 2021, under a three-year deal worth more than $60 million.
